footerEntries: Torodel Yelra has the Boon of High Magic

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The lich - torodel yelra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Liches are the remains of great wizards who embrace undeath as a means of preserving themselves. They further their own power at any cost, having no interest in the affairs of the living except where those affairs interfere with their own. Scheming and insane, they hunger for long-forgotten knowledge and the most terrible secrets. Because the shadow of death doesn't hang over them, they can conceive plans that take years, decades, or centuries to come to fruition.

A lich is a gaunt and skeletal humanoid with withered flesh stretched tight across its bones. Its eyes succumbed to decay long ago, but points of light burn in its empty sockets. It is often garbed in the moldering remains of fine clothing and jewelry worn and dulled by the passage of time.

entries.name: Secrets of Undeath
entries: No wizard takes up the path to lichdom on a whim, and the process of becoming a lich is a well-guarded secret. Wizards that seek lichdom must make bargains with fiends, evil gods, or other foul entities. Many turn to Orcus, Demon Prince of Undeath, whose power has created countless liches. However, those that control the power of lichdom always demand fealty and service for their knowledge.

A lich is created by an arcane ritual that traps the wizard's soul within a phylactery. Doing so binds the soul to the mortal world, preventing it from traveling to the Outer Planes after death. A phylactery is traditionally an amulet in the shape of a small box, but it can take the form of any item possessing an interior space into which arcane sigils of naming, binding, immortality, and dark magic are scribed in silver.

With its phylactery prepared, the future lich drinks a potion of transformation-a vile concoction of poison mixed with the blood of a sentient creature whose soul is sacrificed to the phylactery. The wizard falls dead, then rises as a lich as its soul is drawn into the phylactery, where it forever remains.

entries.name: Soul Sacrifices
entries: A lich must periodically feed souls to its phylactery to sustain the magic preserving its body and consciousness. It does this using the {@spell imprisonment} spell. Instead of choosing one of the normal options of the spell, the lich uses the spell to magically trap the target's body and soul inside its phylactery. The phylactery must be on the same plane as the lich for the spell to work. A lich's phylactery can hold only one creature at a time, and a {@spell dispel magic} cast as a 9th-level spell upon the phylactery releases any creature imprisoned within it. A creature imprisoned in the phylactery for 24 hours is consumed and destroyed utterly, whereupon nothing short of divine intervention can restore it to life.
A lich that fails or forgets to maintain its body with sacrificed souls begins to physically fall apart, and might eventually become a demilich.

entries.name: Death and Restoration
entries: When a lich's body is broken by accident or assault, the will and mind of the lich drains from it, leaving only a lifeless corpse behind. Within days, a new body reforms next to the lich's phylactery, coalescing out of glowing smoke that issues from the device. Because the destruction of its phylactery means the possibility of eternal death, a lich usually keeps its phylactery in a hidden, well-guarded location.

Destroying a lich's phylactery is no easy task and often requires a special ritual, item, or weapon. Every phylactery is unique, and discovering the key to its destruction can be a quest in and of itself.

entries.name: Lonely Existence
entries: From time to time, a lich might be stirred from its single-minded pursuit of power to take an interest in the world around it, most often when some great event reminds it of the life it once led. It otherwise lives in isolation, engaging only with those creatures whose service helps secure its lair.
Few liches call themselves by their former names, instead adopting monikers such as the Black Hand or the Forgotten King.

entries.name: Magic Collectors
entries: Liches collect spells and magic items. In addition to its spell repertoire, a lich has ready access to potions, scrolls, libraries of spellbooks, one or more wands, and perhaps a staff or two. It has no qualms about putting these treasures to use whenever its lair comes under attack.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A lich doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: A Lich's Lair
entries: A lich often haunts the abode it favored in life, such as a lonely tower, a haunted ruin, or an academy of black magic. Alternatively, some liches construct secret tombs filled with powerful guardians and traps. Everything about a lich's lair reflects its keen mind and wicked cunning, including the magic and mundane traps that secure it. Undead, constructs, and bound demons lurk in shadowy recesses, emerging to destroy those who dare to disturb the lich's work.
A lich encountered in its lair has a challenge rating of 22 (41,000 XP).

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the lich can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects; the lich can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The lich rolls a {@dice d8} and regains a spell slot of that level or lower. If it has no spent spell slots of that level or lower, nothing happens.

The lich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. A crackling cord of negative energy tethers the lich to the target. Whenever the lich takes damage, the target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the lich takes half the damage (rounded down), and the target takes the remaining damage. This tether lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round or until the lich or the target is no longer in the lich's lair.

The lich calls forth the spirits of creatures that died in its lair. These apparitions materialize and attack one creature that the lich can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 52 ({@damage 15d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. The apparitions then disappear.

bonus.name: Darkest Despair
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 16} to hit, unlimited range, one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) necrotic damage. The target has disadvantage on the next saving throw they take within 1 minute of being hit by Darkest Despair.

legendary.name: Duke - Move & Attack (1)
entries: The Duke moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks, and does a Bite attack against a target within range

legendary.name: Torodel - Cast spell (2)
entries: Torodel Cast's a spell of 5th level or lower.

legendary.name: Torodel - Paralyzing Touch (1)
entries: Torodel uses his Paralyzing Touch

legendary.name: Torodel and Duke - Claw and Despair (2)
entries: Torodel and the Duke both do something, Torodel uses his Darkest Despair on a target within range, while Duke uses two claw attacks on a target within range.

trait.name: Lightning Reflexes
entries: The Tempest Sword Practitioner has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the Tempest Sword Practitioner is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The practitioner's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Tempest Sword Practitioner makes three attacks: Three Tempest Blade attacks or two Tempest Blade attacks and Wind Blade.

action.name: Tempest Blade - Harkin Sword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) slashing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} as wind pushes the target to the ground.

action.name: Wind Blade {@recharge 5}
entries: The Tempest Sword Practitioner can shoot out from its position a 10-foot-wide wind blade that damages all in a 60-foot line. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Wind Dash
entries: The Tempest Sword Practitioner can move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. If it moves at least 20 feet in a straight line toward a target, it can make one melee weapon attack against that target as part of this bonus action.

reaction.name: Tempest Parry
entries: The Tempest Sword Practitioner adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. It can then make one melee weapon attack against the attacker

monster.name: Blood Count

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Count's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 26}, +18 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Counts Wrath
entries: if the Count would be reduced to 0 hit points, his current hit point total instead resets to 1500 hit points.
Additionally, the Count can now use the options in the Mythic Actions section for 1 hour.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Blood Count regains 50 hit points at the start of its turn. If the Blood Count takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Blood Count can at will polymorph into a bat, a wolf, or a cloud of mist, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The blood count has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The blood count's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The blood count is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Count makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws. Or One with his bite and casts a spell

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d8 + 10}) piercing damage plus 44 ({@damage 8d10}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest, or is affected by the heal, mass heal, or greater restoration spell. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}55 ({@damage 10d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

reactionHeader: The count has 3 Reactions per turn.

reaction.name: Imprisoning Coffin
entries: As a reaction to being attacked, the Blood Count can summon an imprisoning coffin around the attacker. The Blood Count still takes the damage, but the targeted creature is now {@condition restrained}, {@condition blinded}, and {@condition deafened} while trapped within the coffin. The coffin has an AC of 13 and 50 hit points. Any creature can target the coffin. The coffin remains until destroyed or until the Blood Count uses another reaction to summon a new imprisoning coffin.

reaction.name: Spell Copy {@recharge}
entries: When the Count is within 300ft of a creature casting a spell, the blood count can immediately copy the spell and cast it as part of the same reaction.

legendary.name: Legendary Resilience (Costs 3 actions)
entries: The Count ends one spell or harmful effect currently affecting him.

legendary.name: Blooded Neck (Costs 1 Action)
entries: The Count teleports behind one humanoid he can see within 120 feet of him. The Count makes one bite attack towards the humanoid. Additionally if the bite was successful, the targeted humanoid has disadvantage against the Count's Enslaving Charm Ability

legendary.name: Enslaving Charm (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Blood Count targets one humanoid he can see within 30 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the Blood Count until the Blood Count dies or until he is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the Blood Count's control and can't take reactions. The Blood Count can have only one target {@condition charmed} at a time. If the {@condition charmed} target takes any damage, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Blood Count's Enslaving Charm for the next 24 hours.

legendaryHeader: The blood count can take 5 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The blood count regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.
mythicHeader: If the blood count's mythic trait is active, it can use the options below as legendary actions for 1 hour after using Counts Wrath.

mythic.name: Blood Burst (Costs 1 action)
entries: The Blood Count targets one creature he can see within 120 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

mythic.name: Blood Spears (Costs 1 Action)
entries: The Blood Count summons blood-red spears from the ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point it can see within 120 feet. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw, taking 30 ({@damage 6d10}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

mythic.name: Nightmare's Grasp (Costs 1 action)
entries: The Blood Count targets one creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} of the Blood Count for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The fey whale can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Psychic Flight
entries: The fey whale's flight is powered by its psychic energy. It cannot be grounded by any non-psychic effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fey whale makes Three Tentacle attacks . It can swap out two Tentacle attacks and instead do  one Psychic Wave attack.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 40 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 23}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and follows the movement of the Fey whale, and the fey whale can’t use the same tentacle on another target.

The Fey whale can choose how far away or where to position the Tentacle when having a creature {@condition restrained}. It can also choose to end the {@condition restrained} condition by throwing the creature 30ft away.

action.name: Psychic Wave.
entries: The fey whale emits a powerful psychic wave. Each creature of the fey whale's choice within 60 feet of it must make a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw, taking 71 ({@damage 13d10}) psychic damage and being {@condition stunned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and not {@condition stunned} on a successful one. A {@condition stunned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Teleport
entries: The Fey Whale magically teleports, along with any creatures it has {@condition grappled}, to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of it.

trait.name: Poisonous Body
entries: A creature that touches the Megapede or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The megapede can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Megapede makes two attacks: One with its bite and one with its stinger.

action.name: Bite.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the centipede can't bite another target.
The {@condition grappled} target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) poison damage at the start of each of the worm's turns

action.name: Tail Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Keen Scent
entries: The scorpion can use its bonus action to detect the scent of creatures within 60 feet. The scorpion knows the location of creatures with a scent it can detect, though it can't discern individual creatures in a group.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Kunat Scorpion makes two attacks. one with its pincers and one with its stinger

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If the saving throw fails, the target's Strength score increases by +4 for 24 hours. During this time, the target is considered {@condition poisoned}, and they are blind beyond 10 feet. The temporary Strength increase disappears if the poison is removed.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The depth guardian can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The depth guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The depth guardian's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Destined Enemy
entries: The Depth Guardian can sense if a Kraken is within a mile, and precisely where it is.
Additionally, the Depth Guardian ignores any Immunities or features that make Restraining the Kraken impossible.

trait.name: Underwater Combat
entries: The Depth Guardian ignores any disadvantages that fighting underwater gives.

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The Depth Guardian makes two attacks with its Chains of the Deep or one attack with Chains of the Deep and one attack with Radiant Javelin.

action.name: Chains of the Deep
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Depth Guardian can’t use its Chains of the Deep on another target.

action.name: Radiant Javelin
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) radiant damage. If the target is a Kraken, it deals an additional 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Plane Shift (3/day)
entries: The Depth Guardian casts plane shift, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability. The Depth Guardian can cast the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If it uses the latter option, the targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or be banished to a Light chamber in the Divine Plane of The Celestial Ocean.

monster.name: Sar'oktul's Young Kraken

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sar'oktul's Young Kraken's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sar'oktul's young kraken can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Psychic Pressure.
entries: At the start of each of the Young Kraken’s turns, each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. Creatures already once before affected by Psychic pressure have advantage on the Wisdom saving throw.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The sar'oktul's young kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Multiple Tentacles
entries: The sar'oktul's Young Kraken has eight tentacles, a creature can attempt to attack a tentacle instead of damaging sar'oktul's Young Kraken directly. If the creature deals 30 or more damage in a single turn to the tentacle, it is destroyed.
If a creature does not manage to deal enough damage, the tentacle regenerates and heals off all damage dealt to it.
A tentacle regrows on a long rest.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The sar'oktul's young kraken's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sar'oktul's young kraken has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The sar'oktul's young kraken is immune to forced movement, ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained} or {@condition paralyzed}. Only the chains of a Depth Guardian ignores this feature

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sar'oktul's Young Kraken makes Three tentacle attacks, or one tentacle attack, one bite attack and one Psychic Pulse attack.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The Young Kraken has eight tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the Young Kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Young Kraken, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the Young Kraken's turns. If the Young Kraken takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Young Kraken must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the Young Kraken. If the Young Kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the sar'oktul's young kraken's choice that is within 120 feet of the sar'oktul's young kraken and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the sar'oktul's young kraken's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Psychic Pulse
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the Young Kraken's next turn.

action.name: Horrifying Visions (Recharge 5-6).
entries: The Young Kraken projects terrifying visions into the minds of all creatures within 60 feet. Each creature must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage and becoming {@condition frightened} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and not {@condition frightened} on a successful one. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Three Reactions
entries: The sar'oktul's Young Kraken can take three reactions per round.

legendaryHeader: The Young Kraken can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Young Kraken regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Tentacle attack
entries: The Young Kraken makes one Tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Mind Crush (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Young Kraken targets one creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the Young Kraken's next turn.

bonus.name: Fling
entries: One object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the kraken is thrown up to {@dice 3d6 x 10} feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Reel
entries: The kraken pulls each creature {@condition grappled} or object held with its tentacles up to 30 feet to a different direction that it so wishes.

monster.name: Sar'oktul's Adult Kraken

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sar'oktul's Adult Kraken's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 21}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sar'oktul's Adult kraken can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Psychic Pressure.
entries: At the start of each of the Adult Kraken’s turns, each creature within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. Creatures already once before affected by Psychic pressure have advantage on the Wisdom saving throw.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The sar'oktul's Adult kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Multiple Tentacles
entries: The sar'oktul's Adult Kraken has eight tentacles, a creature can attempt to attack a tentacle instead of damaging sar'oktul's Adult Kraken directly. If the creature deals 50 or more damage in a single turn to the tentacle, it is destroyed.
If a creature does not manage to deal enough damage, the tentacle regenerates and heals off all damage dealt to it.
A tentacle regrows on a long rest.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The sar'oktul's Adult kraken's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sar'oktul's Adult kraken has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The sar'oktul's Adult kraken is immune to forced movement, ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained} or {@condition paralyzed}. Only the chains of a Depth Guardian ignores this feature

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Sar'oktul's is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Sar'oktul's Adult Kraken fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sar'oktul's Adult Kraken makes Five tentacle attacks, or two tentacle attacks, one bite attack and one Psychic Pulse attack.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 3d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 24}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The Adult Kraken has eight tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h} 65 ({@damage 10d10 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the Adult Kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Adult Kraken, and it takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) psychic damage and 35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the Adult Kraken's turns. If the Adult Kraken takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Adult Kraken must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the Adult Kraken. If the Adult Kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 25 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the sar'oktul's Adult kraken's choice that is within 120 feet of the sar'oktul's Adult kraken and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the sar'oktul's Adult kraken's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Psychic Pulse
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h} 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the Adult Kraken's next turn.

action.name: Horrifying Visions (Recharge 5-6).
entries: The Adult Kraken projects terrifying visions into the minds of all creatures within 90 feet. Each creature must make a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) psychic damage and becoming {@condition frightened} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and not {@condition frightened} on a successful one. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Three Reactions
entries: The sar'oktul's Adult Kraken can take three reactions per round.

legendaryHeader: The Adult Kraken can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Adult Kraken regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Tentacle attack
entries: The Adult Kraken makes one Tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Mind Crush (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Adult Kraken targets one creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Intelligence saving throw or take 54 ({@damage 12d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the Adult Kraken's next turn.

legendary.name: Horrifying Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Adult kraken casts one of its spells.

bonus.name: Fling
entries: One object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the kraken is thrown up to {@dice 3d6 x 10} feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Reel
entries: The kraken pulls each creature {@condition grappled} or object held with its tentacles up to 30 feet to a different direction that it so wishes.

monster.name: Sar'oktul's Elder Kraken

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sar'oktul's Elder Kraken's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 23}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The sar'oktul's Elder kraken can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Psychic Pressure.
entries: At the start of each of the Elder Kraken’s turns, each creature within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn. Creatures already once before affected by Psychic pressure have advantage on the Wisdom saving throw.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The sar'oktul's Elder kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Multiple Tentacles
entries: The sar'oktul's Elder Kraken has eight tentacles, a creature can attempt to attack a tentacle instead of damaging sar'oktul's Elder Kraken directly. If the creature deals 75 or more damage in a single turn to the tentacle, it is destroyed.
If a creature does not manage to deal enough damage, the tentacle regenerates and heals off all damage dealt to it.
A tentacle regrows on a long rest.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The sar'oktul's Elder kraken's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sar'oktul's Elder kraken has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The sar'oktul's Elder kraken is immune to forced movement, ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained} or {@condition paralyzed}. Only the chains of a Depth Guardian ignores this feature

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Sar'oktul's is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Sar'oktul's Elder Kraken fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Wrath of Sar'oktul
entries: Whenever the Elder Kraken Surfaces, churning storm clouds form in the sky within 10 miles of it. gale-force winds howl, lightning flashes and thunder booms. The area becomes lightly obscured, any nonmagical flames are extinguished, ranged nonmagical weapons attacks have disadvantage and any fog, mists, and similar phenomena in the area, whether mundane or magical, are dispersed automatically.

In addition, the becomes rough. The water within the area counts as difficult terrain. Characters might experience strong, unexpected currents and high waves, resulting in ships capsizing or breaking apart and other dangers.
The effects disappear within 10 minutes after the kraken dives again or dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sar'oktul's Elder Kraken can use its Frightful presence. it then makes one attack with each of its eight tentacles. It can swap out a tentacle attack for a Psychic Pulse, and two tentacle attacks for a Bite attack.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 90 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 26}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The Elder Kraken has eight tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h} 65 ({@damage 10d10 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the Elder Kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Elder Kraken, and it takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) psychic damage and 42 ({@damage 12d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the Elder Kraken's turns. If the Elder Kraken takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Elder Kraken must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the Elder Kraken. If the Elder Kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 40 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the sar'oktul's Elder kraken's choice that is within 600 feet of the sar'oktul's Elder kraken and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the sar'oktul's Elder kraken's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

A creature that is captaining a ship within this area has disadvantage on the saving throw as it experiences visions of the kraken's enormous tentacles dragging down their beloved ship into the fathomless depth of the sea.

action.name: Psychic Pulse
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 15} to hit, range 300 ft., one target. {@h} 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the Elder Kraken's next turn.

action.name: Horrifying Visions (Recharge 5-6).
entries: The Elder Kraken projects terrifying visions into the minds of all creatures within 120 feet. Each creature must make a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) psychic damage and becoming {@condition frightened} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and not {@condition frightened} on a successful one. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Three Reactions
entries: The sar'oktul's Elder Kraken can take five reactions per round.

reaction.name: Deflect Siege Missiles
entries: The kraken uses a tentacle that is not grappling anything to block a large projectile thrown or shot by a siege weapon. The kraken must make a Strength Athletics check contested by the attack roll. On a success, it takes no damage from the attack as it successfully deflects the projectile.

reaction.name: Ship's Doom
entries: When a ship leaves the kraken's reach, the kraken can use its reaction to make one tentacle grapple the ship, holding the ship in place but making one of its tentacles remain there. Every time the tentacle takes 40 or more damage, the kraken needs to succeed on a {@dc 28} constitution saving throw or let go of the ship.

legendaryHeader: The Elder Kraken can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Elder Kraken regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Tentacle attack
entries: The Elder Kraken makes one Tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Mind Crush (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Elder Kraken targets one creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Intelligence saving throw or take 54 ({@damage 12d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the Elder Kraken's next turn.

legendary.name: Horrifying Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Elder kraken casts one of its spells.

legendary.name: Titan's Crush (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature {@condition restrained} by the Elder kraken must make a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage and has disadvantage on any ability checks it makes to attempt to escape from being {@condition restrained} by the kraken until the end of its next turn. On a success, it takes half as much damage without any other effects.

Objects held by the kraken's tentacles take the damage automatically. If the kraken uses this ability to attempt to crush a ship held in its tentacles, everyone on board that ship must make a {@dc 18} dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Fling
entries: One object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the kraken is thrown up to {@dice 3d6 x 10} feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Reel
entries: The kraken pulls each creature {@condition grappled} or object held with its tentacles up to 60 feet to a different direction that it so wishes.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Krakenborn's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1: {@spell dominate monster} (Can only target aquatic creatures)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The krakenborn mage can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Krakenborn Mage makes two Falchion attacks.

action.name: Falchion
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Summon Ethereal Tentacles (Recharge 5-6):
entries: The Krakenborn Mage summons ethereal tentacles at a point it can see within 60 feet. Each creature within a 20-foot radius of that point must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition restrained} by the tentacles. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature can use its action to make a {@dc 16} Strength check, freeing itself on a success. The tentacles last for 1 minute or until the Krakenborn Mage dismisses them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The krakenborn warrior can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the krakenborn warrior hits with it.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The krakenborn warrior has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the krakenborn warrior's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Swimming Leap
entries: With a 10-foot swimming start, the Krakenborn can long jump out of or across the water up to 25 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Krakenborn makes three attacks with its falchion.

action.name: Falchion
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tentacle Slam.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Krakenborn can't use its tentacle slam on another target.

action.name: Ranged Attack: Harpoon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Whirlwind Attack (Recharge 5-6).
entries: The Krakenborn makes a melee attack against all creatures within 5 feet of it. Each creature hit takes damage equal to the falchion's damage plus an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The mist hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the mist hound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The mist hound has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Cowardly Nature
entries: The Mist Hound has disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Misty Step {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the Mist Hound can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Mist Hounds are elusive creatures that dwell high in the mountains, far from human settlements. They are known for their ability to teleport short distances, which they use to evade predators and ambush prey. Mist Hounds live in packs and rely on their numbers to hunt, but they are inherently cowardly and will flee if faced with significant resistance. Their misty step ability makes them difficult to capture or corner, adding to their mystique and danger. When driven by hunger, these creatures will descend from their mountain homes and may pose a threat to livestock and unwary travelers.

trait.name: Withering Aura
entries: All plants and vegetation within 10 feet of the Child of Decay wither and die. At the start of each of a creature's turns while within 10 feet of the Child of Decay, it must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the Child of Decay to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the Child of Decay drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The weaker child of decay can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The weaker child of decay can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

The Child of Decay is a horrifying fusion of undead and ooze, possessing a black tar-like body that saps life from anything nearby. Originating from the Celestial Necropolis, it is thought to have been created by Alaso, known as the Herald of Decay. These creatures are relentless in their hunger, growing stronger as they drain life force from their surroundings. Their presence causes all vegetation within ten feet to wither and die, marking their territory with death and decay. Legends say that the more life they consume, the more formidable they become, making them a growing threat. Often found in desolate areas, their very existence is a blight on the living world. Their creation remains a dark testament to Alaso's mastery over decay and corruption.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The mist hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the mist hound's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The mist hound has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pounce (Panther)
entries: If the adult mist hound moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the adult mist hound can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Mist hound can attack twice. Once with its bite and once with its claw

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Misty Step {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the Mist Hound can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Mist Hounds are elusive creatures that dwell high in the mountains, far from human settlements. They are known for their ability to teleport short distances, which they use to evade predators and ambush prey. Mist Hounds live in packs and rely on their numbers to hunt, but they are inherently cowardly and will flee if faced with significant resistance. Their misty step ability makes them difficult to capture or corner, adding to their mystique and danger. When driven by hunger, these creatures will descend from their mountain homes and may pose a threat to livestock and unwary travelers.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The krakenborn warrior can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the krakenborn warrior hits with it.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The krakenborn warrior has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the krakenborn warrior's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Swimming Leap
entries: With a 10-foot swimming start, the Krakenborn can long jump out of or across the water up to 25 feet.

trait.name: Elite Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the Krakenborn Slayer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Krakenborn makes three attacks with its Falcion, Tentacle Slam and lastly Harpoon.

action.name: Falchion
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tentacle Slam.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Krakenborn can't use its tentacle slam on another target.

action.name: Ranged Attack: Harpoon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Whirlwind Attack (Recharge 5-6).
entries: The Krakenborn makes a melee attack against all creatures within 5 feet of it. Each creature hit takes damage equal to the falchion's damage plus an additional 22 ({@damage 4d10}) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Falchion
entries: The Krakenborn Slayer does a Falchion Attack

legendary.name: Rallying Cry
entries: The Krakenborn Slayer utters a powerful command. All allies within 30 feet that can hear it gain 10 temporary hit points.

legendary.name: Commanding Strike
entries: The Krakenborn Slayer commands two allies within 30 feet to make one weapon attack.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The fey penguin has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the fey penguin to sleep.

trait.name: Keen memory
entries: Fey Penguin's can recall anything they have seen or heard within the last 100 years.

trait.name: Belly Side
entries: While {@condition prone} on ice or a similarly slick surface, the penguin has a movement speed of 40 feet. In addition, it only requires 5 feet to stand up from {@condition prone} when using this movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fey Penguin makes three Snowball attacks

action.name: Snowball
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d4 + 5}) cold damage.

bonus.name: Fey Step {@recharge 4}
entries: The Fey Penguin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The owlbear cub has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight or smell.

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The owlbear makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Redglow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shadow Form.
entries: The Redglow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. It has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in dim light or darkness.

bonus.name: Dark Step
entries: As a bonus action, the Redglow can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Redglow makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Shadowstep Ambush.
entries: When a creature targets the Redglow with a ranged weapon attack, the Redglow can use its reaction to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space adjacent to the attacking creature. It then makes one claw attack against that creature.

reaction.name: Teleportation Dodge.
entries: When the Redglow is targeted by a melee attack, it can use its reaction to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. The triggering attack misses the Redglow.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Shadeclaw's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Shade blast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) force damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The shadeclaw can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the shadeclaw can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

The Shadeclaw is a small, shadowy fey creature with piercing red eyes that glow ominously in the dark. It moves with unsettling grace, its long claws leaving faint trails of darkness as it effortlessly crawls along walls and ceilings. Shadeclaws are cunning and elusive, often using their minor illusion and invisibility abilities to deceive and disorient their foes. Though individually weak, they are rarely encountered alone. Shadeclaws rely on their numbers to overwhelm and subdue stronger adversaries, swarming them with a combination of stealthy strikes and magical trickery.

These creatures are typically lesser minions, controlled by powerful dark archfey. Commanding the Shadeclaw's to venture into the Material Plane to spread chaos and fear. Serving as spies, assassins, and saboteurs, Shadeclaws carry out their master's will with ruthless efficiency, leaving behind only whispers and shadows in their wake.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Adorian Wizard is a 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks), The Adorian Wizard has the following Wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Unknowable Secrets
entries: Any attempt to form a mental link with the Adorian Wizard, cast scrying or cast speak with dead on the wizard automatically fails, and the creature that initiated the attempt takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage

action.name: Adorian Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. Hit points lost to this weapon's damage can only be regained through a long rest.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The adorian agent has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the adorian agent's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Dutiful Agent
entries: The Adorian Agent has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Adorian Agent makes two attacks. One with its longsword and one with its shield bash

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Adorian Agent adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Adorian Agent must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The slush affected has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee attack deals one extra die of its damage when the slush affected hits with it.

trait.name: Crazed State
entries: Due to the Slush Drug their to hit is reduced by 6

action.name: Strangle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit -2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) and knocked {@condition prone}. Until the grapple ends, the target can't speak properly or cast spells with verbal components.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit -2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hurl Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit -2} to hit, range 20/30 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Hex Warrior.
entries: The warlock's weapon attacks use its Charisma modifier to calculate attack rolls and damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Eldritch Grasp
entries: When the warlock hits a creature with its eldritch blast, the target is pulled 10 feet in a straight line toward the warlock, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of the warlock's next turn.

trait.name: Pact Weapon
entries: This weapon functions as a magical +1 weapon.
The pact weapon disappears if it is away from the warlock for 1 minute or more, the warlock dismisses it (no action required), or the warlock dies.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Agent of the Black Root makes Two longsword attacks.

action.name: Pact Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Agent adds 2 to its AC against one Melee attack that would hit it, to do so the agent must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon

action.name: Shortsword

action.name: Light Crossbow

action.name: Flintlock Pistol

action.name: Revolver
