spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Malgrinner's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shapechange
entries: The Malgrinner can use its action to polymorph into a small or medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Invisible Passage
entries: The Malgrinner magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While {@condition invisible}, it leaves no physical evidence of its passage, so it can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment it wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The malgrinner has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Malgrinner makes two attacks with its poison dagger. After those attacks the Malgrinner uses its Invisible Passage ability

action.name: Poison Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. The Target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Bladed Body
entries: Any creature that makes a melee attack against the Malkris takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage from touching the blades on its body.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The malkris has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the malkris's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Malkris makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) acid damage

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Xylokra

trait.name: Psychic Impact.
entries: When the Xylokra deals Force damage to a creature. The creature has to succeed a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw or take additional 16 ({@damage 3d10}) Psychic damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The xylokra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Tentacle Sacrifice.
entries: The Xylokra has 5 Tentacles. Whenever it fails a saving throw, it can choose to lose one of its tentacles to succeed on the save instead.

trait.name: Regrow Tentacle (Regrow 6).
entries: If the Xylokra loses one or more of its Tentacles. At the end of each of its turns roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6 it regrows a Tentacle together with 20 hit points.

trait.name: Death Burst.
entries: When the Xylokra dies, it explodes in a burst of a Psychic screech that appears in every creature's head that within 240ft. Each creature within 240 ft. of it must make a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) Psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The Xylokra makes up to five attacks using its tentacle beams, 3 Tentacle beams and Intense Observation or 2 Tentacle beams and Psychic Elimination.

action.name: Tentacle beam.
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120/300 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) Force damage.
The target must make a saving throw for Psychic Impact

action.name: Psychic Elimination {@recharge 5}
entries: The Xylokra gathers its tentacles in front of its eye. Shooting out a translucent beam in a 120-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) force damage plus 5 for each tentacle that it uses on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one

action.name: Intense observation.
entries: The Xylokra focuses its arcane eye on a creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The Xylokra intensely observes the target for 6 seconds (1 round). The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw or the Xylokra learns about the target's vulnerabilities, resistances, immunities, abilities, and whether it poses a threat to the Xylokra. On a successful save, the target is unaffected. A creature that successfully saves against this ability can't be affected by it again for 24 hours.

bonus.name: Astral Shift.
entries: As a bonus action, the Xylokra can teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see

reaction.name: Tentacle shielding
entries: As a reaction the Xylokra raises a tentacle to block an incoming attack. Raising its AC by 5 against a melee or range attack that would hit it. This is essentially the Xylokra summoning a shield spell on that individual tentacle

reactionHeader: The Xylokra has the same amount of reactions as tentacles. For each Tentacle that it loses, it loses a reaction.
legendaryHeader: The xylokra can take 1 legendary action for each tentacle it currently has, (standard 5) choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The xylokra regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Tentacle Beam (Costs 1 Action)
entries: The Xylokra makes a Tentacle beam attack

legendary.name: Astral Shift (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Xylokra uses its Astral Shift ability.

legendary.name: Mind Flare (Costs 3 Actions).
entries: The Xylokra releases a pulse of psychic energy in a 30-foot radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The vepus scout can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The vepus scout has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the vepus scout's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Thin Frame
entries: You can squeeze through spaces as if you were a Small creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Vepus Scout makes two attacks

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) damage.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: The soul shepherd's weapon attacks are magical. When the soul shepherd hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 4d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The the soul shepherds has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The Soul Shepherds can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The the soul shepherds can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@dice 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The soul shepherd's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, +11 to hit with spell attack). The soul shepherd can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The soul shepherd makes two Mace attacks or uses Ethereal Bolt twice. As well as Teleport on their turn. In no specific order

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Ethereal Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The soul shepherd magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 90 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: The soul shepherd touches a creature. The target magically regains 20 ({@dice 4d8 + 6}) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

action.name: Guiding Light {@recharge 5}
entries: The soul shepherd emits a radiant burst of energy in a 30-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Undead and fiends have disadvantage on this saving throw.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The fragment of the red priest can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@dice 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The fragment of the red priest is immune to effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The fragment of the red priest has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Fragment’s innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Fragment makes two Spectral Claw attacks or uses its Possession.

action.name: Spectral Claw.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Possession (Recharge 5-6).
entries: The Fragment of the Red Priest targets one humanoid that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the Fragment; the Fragment then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The Fragment now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The Fragment can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the Fragment ends it as a bonus action, or the Fragment is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the Fragment reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this Fragment's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the deathworm to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the deathworm drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The deathworm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deathworm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Curse of Decay
entries: A creature infected by the Curse of Decay will begin transforming into an undead version of themselves. The Transformation takes {@dice 3d6} days, during which the creature's alignment becomes neutral evil and it loses its sanity. When the transformation is complete, the target dies and rises again as an undead version of itself. It becomes Resistant to Necrotic damage and vulnerable to Radiant damage.
The process can be halted by a greater restoration spell or similar magic before the transformation is complete.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Deathworm makes two attacks: one with its Bite and one with its Tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 4d10 + 9}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the Deathworm. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the Deathworm, and takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of the Deathworm's turns. If the Deathworm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the Deathworm must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the Deathworm. If the Deathworm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. The target must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or be infected with the Deathworm's Curse of Decay (See Curse of Decay)

action.name: Necrotic Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The Deathworm exhales a wave of necrotic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The Deathworms were horrific creations birthed by Alaso, the God of Undeath, during the Great Undeath War. This conflict saw Zeena, the Blood Monarch, and Alaso clash in a destructive struggle, devastating the continent of Navaro. As the two forces of undeath vied for supremacy, Alaso shaped these gargantuan monstrosities to ravage the battlefield, tearing through both living and undead alike.

Deathworms were designed to burrow beneath the earth, emerging with terrifying speed to devour entire battalions or drag down the unfortunate into the cursed soil. Their very presence exudes necrotic energy, corrupting the land and leaving it barren in their wake. Even after the war ended, many Deathworms remained in the desolate, accursed lands of Navaro, eternally hunting anything that still clings to life. These colossal undead creatures now roam the wasteland, driven by an insatiable hunger for destruction.

trait.name: Action Surge (1/Short or Long Rest)
entries: Aiden Thorn takes one additional action

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: Aiden Thorn's attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: Aiden Thorn rerolls a failed saving throw. He must use the new roll.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee attack deals one extra die of its damage when Aiden thorn hits with it. (Already Added)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Aiden Thorn makes two unarmed Strikes

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Hellfire Strikes)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

bonus.name: Hellfire Steps (Infernal Steps Technique)
entries: Aiden thorn's steps leave behind burning hellfire. The hellfire does not spread, but it damages both friends and foes. If a creature enters or starts their turn in the area where hellfire is burning, they take {@damage 2d6} fire damage. The hellfire disappears after 4 turns.

bonus.name: Hellfire strikes (Infernal Steps Technique)
entries: Aiden thorn takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage (Ignoring his Resistance) and for the next minute, his attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The kunat scorpion has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Kunat Scorpion makes two attacks. One with its Pincers and one with its stinger.

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

The target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the target's strength score increases by +4 for {@dice 2d12} hours. During this time, the target is {@condition poisoned}, and they are blind beyond 10 feet. The temporary strength increase disappears if the {@condition poisoned} effect is removed.

trait.name: Inquisitor's Training
entries: The Imperial Inquisitor has expertise in stealth, investigation, insight, and perception skills. They have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the imperial inquisitor is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the imperial inquisitor instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Once per turn, the imperial inquisitor deals an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the imperial inquisitor that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the imperial inquisitor doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker that the Imperial Inquisitor Agent can see hits them with an attack, they can use their reaction to halve the attack's damage against them.

bonus.name: Steady Aim
entries: The Imperial Inquisitor gives themselves advantage on their next attack roll on the current turn. They can use this bonus action only if they haven't moved during this turn, and after they use the bonus action, their speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Imperial Inquisitor Agent makes two attacks with their shortswords or throwing their daggers.

action.name: Shortswords
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Daggers
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/40 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Talon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Talon makes two dagger attacks and uses Shroud Self.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shroud Self
entries: The Talon magically turns {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn. This invisibility ends if the Talon makes an attack roll, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

bonus.name: Cower
entries: Hostile creatures within 10ft of the Talon must make a Charisma Saving Throw {@dc 15}. On a failed save they gain vulnerability to piercing damage while within 10ft of the Talon, unless they have resistance or immunity to such damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Talon's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shapechanger (Changeling)
entries: The the crimson talon As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height and weight, but not so much that your size changes. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait.
You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The the crimson talon has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the the crimson talon to sleep.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the the crimson talon deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the the crimson talon that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the the crimson talon doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Crimson Talon makes two dagger attacks and uses Shroud Self.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shroud Self
entries: The Talon magically turns {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn. This invisibility ends if the Talon makes an attack roll, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

bonus.name: Cower
entries: Hostile creatures within 10ft of the Crimson Talon must make a Charisma Saving Throw {@dc 17}. On a failed save they gain vulnerability to piercing damage while within 10ft of the Crimson Talon, unless they have resistance or immunity to such damage.

trait.name: Killer's Fury
entries: Captain Anderson deals an extra 4 ({@dice 1d8}) damage when he hits with a weapon attack (included in the attacks).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Captain Anderson makes two attacks with his Blood Cleaver or Javelin

action.name: Blood Cleaver +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.
(Reflavored Greataxe, Magical Damage)

action.name: Harpoon (Javelin)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

action.name: Battle Cry (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of Captain Anderson's choice that is within 30 feet of him, can hear him, must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom Saving Throw or be {@condition frightened} of Captain Anderson for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, Captain Anderson can move up to his speed toward a hostile creature that he can see.

reaction.name: Rageful Strike
entries: As a reaction to getting hit by a melee attack, Captain Anderson can use his reaction to attack the creature back.

hp.special: 10 + three times your Architect level (the Protector has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Architect level)

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: The Protector can't be {@status surprised}.

trait.name: Shared Perception
entries: The Protector has the same Passive Perception as you

action.name: Empowered Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + PB} force damage.

action.name: Repair (2/Day)
entries: The magical mechanisms inside the Protector restore {@dice 2d6 + PB} hit points to itself or to one construct or object within 5 feet of it.

hp.special: 10 + two times your Architect level (the Arcane Turret has a number of Hit Dice [d8s] equal to your Architect level)

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: The Arcane Turret can't be {@status surprised}.

trait.name: Shared Perception
entries: The Arcane Turret has the same Passive Perception as you

action.name: Arcane Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + PB} force damage.

action.name: Multiattack (Architect 5th level)
entries: The Arcane Turret makes two arcane shot attacks.

action.name: Arcane Shot (Architect 9th level)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 2d8 + PB} force damage.

action.name: Arcane Shot (Architect 15th level)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 120/480 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 3d8 + PB} force damage.

action.name: Arcane Disruption (1/day) (Architect 15th level)
entries: As an action, the turret can unleash Arcane Disruption, creating a massive arcane explosion at a point of your choice within 60 feet of the turret. Each creature within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw against your Architect spell save DC.

On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d10} + your Intelligence modifier force damage and becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Illusiary form
entries: While beyond 60ft of Father Christmas, a friendly illusion of the jolly man will appear, while inside 60ft the true ripped form of Saint Nick is visible. Here he is smoking a cigar, tattoos across his arms and along his head

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Father Christmas' has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Father Christmas' weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day) (Reset on new form)
entries: If father Christmas' fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Presence of Christmas
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 60ft of Father Christmas takes {@damage 2d10} psychic damage.

bonus.name: Naughty List
entries: As a bonus action, Father Christmas can choose a creature within 60ft.
Adding their name to his Naughty List.

A creature whose name is on the list will have a illusiary stocking hovering over their head additionally If they are reduced below 50 hit points by Father Christmas, the are decapitated and immediately die.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Father Christmas can attack two times

action.name: Candy Greatsword +3
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 20} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 2d12 + 14}) slashing damage.
Crit on 19 and 20.

action.name: Coal Boulder
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) damage bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Move & Attack (1)
entries: Father Christmas moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks, and does a Candy Greatsword against a target within range.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Father Christmas' has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day) (Reset on new form)
entries: If father Christmas' fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Father Christmas is an 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom, requiring no material components (spell save {@dc 22}, +14 to hit with spell attacks). Father Christmas has the following spells prepared:

legendary.name: Cast Spell (2)
entries: Father Christmas cast's a spell of 3rd level or lower

legendary.name: Gift of Manipulation (1)
entries: Choose a creature within 60ft. They need to make a {@dc 22} Charisma Check, on a failure, they spend their reaction attacking a creature within their reach.

bonus.name: You've been naughty
entries: Father Christmas targets a creature within 120ft that has been Naughty. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or they will have Disadvantage on all saving throws for the next 1 minute.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The reindeer has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Reindeer makes two attacks: one with its bite and the other with its fist.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) damage.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) damage.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: The klaus has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Arcane Turrets
entries: Klaus Klattermaus has 4 arcane turrets protecting him. Using the Architect's Arcane Turret lvl 14 statblock.

trait.name: Focus Stabilizer
entries: When Klaus fails a constitution saving throw to maintain {@status concentration} on a spell. He can use his reaction to automatically succeed instead.

trait.name: Enhanced Mobility
entries: Klaus Klattermaus' speed increased by 30ft

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Klaus is a 14th-level Architect. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 19}, +11 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following Architect spells prepared:

bonus.name: Arcane Step (3 times)
entries: Klaus can use Misty step 3 times a day as a bonus action. (30ft)

reaction.name: Shield
entries: Klaus as a reaction cast's Shield

monster.name: Nulku
languages: Cannot speak. Can telepathically speak any language that its larvae's host knows

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: The Nulku can control all creatures that have a functioning larva fused with them, as long as they are on the same plane of existence as the Nulku. This control is facilitated through the arcane realm, acting as a tether between the Nulku and its controlled subjects.

trait.name: Elite Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the Nulku fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nulku has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The nulku can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Nulku's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The Nulku makes three attacks: One with its bite and two with its legs.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leg Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Psychic Assault {@recharge 5}
entries: The Nulku targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 8d6 + 5}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn and suffers Minor Brain Damage -

*You have disadvantage on Wisdom and Intelligence checks, as well as Constitution saving throws to maintain {@status concentration}. This effect heals after 2 weeks of rest or with a greater restoration spell.*

legendaryGroup.name: Celador Talis
lairActions: When fighting inside his lair, Celador talis can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Celador talis can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:
- Celador Talis rolls a d8 and regains a spell slot of that level or lower. If he has no spent spell slots of that level or lower, nothing happens.

- Celador Talis flicks his fingers and out from the walls come green motes of light. Everyone in the room can choose to regain hit points equal to 10d10. Choosing to regain it, in return makes your next 3 saving throws be at disadvantage.
- Celador Talis snaps his finger, and a enchanted rune appears in the ceiling. The hostile creature with the lowest amount of hit points within the lair is targeted by a Power Word Kill spell.

- Celador Talis creates arcane arms to rise form the ground in a 20-foot square that he can see. The arcane arms last until the next initiative count 20. Each creature in that area when the arms appear must succeed on a DC 25 Strength saving throw or be restrained until the arms disappear or until Celador Talis releases them (no action required)
The celador talis can't repeat an effect until they have all been used, and it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.
regionalEffects: Objects
○ Ray enhancer
Celador can shoot a ray or beam like spell or his Arcane Burst ability. If it passes through the ray enhancer, it doubles the damage and doubles the range aswell.
Example; Disintegrate spell can be targeted as if the range was doubled if the ray will pass through the enhancer.
○ Stunning Wave (legendary Action)

Celador can spend a legendary action to trigger the stunning wave, As a wave of purple arcane energy pushes through the center of the lair. Any hostile creature caught in this energy must succeed on a DC 28 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until the end of their next turn.
○ Cold Wave (legendary Action)

Celador can spend a legendary action to trigger the Cold wave, as a wave of cold energy pushes through the center of the lair both from the top and bottom objects. Any hostile creature caught in this wave must succeed on a DC 28 constitution saving throw, taking 10d6 Cold damage or half as much damage on a successful save.
○ Force field's

Celador can move to a golden platform and as a bonus action activate it. This will summon a force field that acts as a Wall of Force. The wall appears where the golden arcane energies exit. The back of the platform being completely open.
When Celador moves off it, it disappears.
Other creatures can attempt to activate the Force Field as a bonus action by succeeding on a Arcana check DC 40.
○ Displacement pillars
Celador can touch a pillar and teleport to another pillar in the lair.

legendaryGroup.name: Blood Count
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, the blood count can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the blood count can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

- The walls of the chamber begin to ooze with dark, viscous bloody tendrils. Each creature within 60 feet of the Blood Count must make a DC 26 Dexterity saving throw or take 22 (4d10) slashing damage from the sharp tendrils of blood that slash those around their count. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage.

- The Blood Count calls forth 1d4 vampire spawn to aid it in battle. These vampire spawn appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the Blood Count and act immediately after him in the initiative order. They remain for 1 minute or until destroyed, after which they crumble to dust.

- Magical darkness spreads from a point the Blood Count chooses within 60 feet of it, filling a 20-foot-radius sphere until the Blood Count dismisses it as an action, uses this lair action again, or dies. The darkness spreads around corners, and any creature fully within it is blinded. A creature within the area when the darkness appears, or that enters it for the first time on a turn, must make a DC 26 Constitution saving throw, taking 44 (8d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that ends its turn in the darkness takes 22 (4d10) necrotic damage.

- The area becomes enveloped in deep shadows, dimming all light and creating an eerie atmosphere. Each creature within 60 feet of the Blood Count must make a DC 26 Constitution saving throw, taking 5d10 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The Blood Count regains hit points equal to half the total damage dealt by this effect.
The blood count can't repeat an effect until they have all been used, and it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

legendaryGroup.name: Sar'oktul's Krakens
lairActions: Sar'oktul's krakens usually live in dark depths, such as sunken rifts or caverns filled with treasure and wrecked ships, while on the material plane. It's said that Kraken's while in their lair's get their strength from their creators divine plane Avathis: Sailor's Grave.
Some say krakens hoard treasure just like dragons.
On Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the kraken takes a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects:

{@b Wild Current} The kraken creates a strong current in a 600-foot line that is 60 feet wide. All creatures caught in that current must make a DC 20 Strength saving throw. On a failure, they are pulled up to 3d8 x 100 closer to the kraken or pushed the same distance away (Kraken's choice) and are knocked prone.

{@b Destructive Wrath} The Kraken, in its wrath, causes a part of its lair to crumble. Each creature within a 30-foot radius centered on a point the kraken can see within its lair must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone and restrained by debris, on a success it takes half as much damage without any other effects.

{@b Blasphemous Chants} Choral chants echo through the halls of the kraken's lair as if worshippers were praying to the kraken. Each creature other than the kraken that can hear these chorales must make a DC 20 wisdom saving throw, taking 9 (2d8) psychic damage on a failure or half as much on a success. In addition, on a failed save, a creature becomes frightened until the end of its next turn. Meanwhile, the kraken itself benefits from a {@i Heal} spell cast on it and has advantage on all saving throws until the next initiative count 20.
regionalEffects: The region containing a kraken's lair is warped by the creature's presence, creating the following magical effects:
{@b Never ending Storms} The kraken can alter the weAether at will in a 12-mile radius centered on its lair. The effect is identical to the control weAether spell.

{@b Repelling Currents} Strong currents try to push unwanted visitors away from the lair. These currents can be first encountered within 10 miles of the lair and become more common closer to the lair.
{@b Cursed Waters} Rifts to the Divine Plane of Avathis: Sailor's Grave may open within 6 miles of the lair.
{@b Titan's servants} Aquatic creatures within 6 miles of the lair that have an intelligence score of 2 or lower are charmed by the kraken and become aggressive toward intruders in the area.

{@b Unholy Forbiddance} The area within 1 mile of the kraken's lair is under the effect of a forbiddance spell targeting celestials. Preventing Depth Guardian's from hunting the krakens in their lairs.

legendaryGroup.name: Xylokra
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, the xylokra can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the xylokra can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

Eyes of the Astral sea: Thousands of purple eyes materialize along the edges of the dimension and fixate on creatures within. Each creature that can see these eyes must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of its next turn. A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more is paralyzed with fear instead.

Reality Shift: The Xylokra bends the fabric of the dimension, causing the ground to become treacherous and unstable. Each creature on the ground must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. The ground becomes difficult terrain until the beginning of the Xylokra's next turn.

Arcane Surge: The arcane energy of the dimension surges, empowering the Xylokra's attacks. On its next turn, the Xylokra's Tentacle Beam and Psychic Elimination actions deal an additional 1d10 force damage on a hit.
The xylokra can't repeat an effect until they have all been used, and it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.
